702161f-b.text:
(1)
4626 to 4640 White Plains Road, east side, between East 240th and East 241st Streets. The large stone and wood house, No. 4626-4628, is the Nereid Fire Co. House. The view is in a northerly direction.
June 6, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
An exclusive view of the Nereid Fire Co. House, at No. 4626-4628.
June 6, 1928.
P.L. Sperr.
(3)
A view of the south side of the fire house, as seen from the south side of Sommer Street. The latter, no longer in existence in 1937, ran the length of the two houses shown, and connected White Plains Road (left) with Garden Place (the latter, too, is no longer in existence at this date). Also shown is the elevated structure of the I.R.T. White Plains Road subway line.
May 24, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
702161f-b.folder: White Plains Road & 240th Street (East), Bronx, NY

701286f-a.text:
Hugh J. Grant Circle, looking northeastward from White Plains Road. On the right is the elevated structure and station of the I.R.T. subway, on Westchester Avenue.
April 10, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The north side of Hugh J. Grant Circle, between Virginia Avenue and Storrow Street. A theatre and stores are being erected here.
June 30, 1940
P. L. Sperr
(3)
The south side of Hugh J. Grant Circle, near E. 177th Street.
June 30, 1940
P. L. Sperr
